DATA.title: Provide APIs for compliance team review/approval/denial of deletion/redaction actions
DATA.summary: Develop and expose secure APIs that allow the compliance team to review, approve, or deny deletion and redaction actions as part of the right-to-erasure process. These APIs must enforce access controls and record all review decisions for full auditability.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: include APIs for compliance team review/approval, and enforce access controls

DATA.title: Implement dashboards and scheduled reports for RtE monitoring and metrics
DATA.summary: Build dashboards and enable scheduled reporting to monitor right-to-erasure (RtE) operations and related metrics in real time. These tools support operational and compliance oversight, enabling visibility into system actions and exceptions.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: Real-time monitoring, dashboarding, and comprehensive operational reporting are required

DATA.title: Log all RtE actions in real-time to a secure, access-controlled meta-log system
DATA.summary: Ensure that every right-to-erasure (RtE) action is logged in real time to a secure meta-log system with strict access controls. These meta-logs must be tamper-evident, cryptographically validated, and support audit and compliance requirements.

reasoning.source_summary_fragment: All deletion/redaction actions must be secure, tamper-evident, and logged with detailed meta-logs, requiring cryptographic validation and hash chaining.
